content:
Added "write answer" to stub generator.

Added the second constraint that no digit appears consecutively more than 9 times for any element in the series.
I have taken the liberty of expanding the statement to include more description of the series. I have solved the puzzle and vote to approve. Simple but enjoyable. Good job.

I approved.
Maybe you can add some explained examples of the reversed look-and-say serie, like:
1211 -> 1x"2"+1x"1" = 21 -> 2x"1" = 11 -> 1x"1" = 1
42 -> 4x"2"=2212 stop as you cannot find a number whose look-and-say is 2222

I second that. I'm actually even more strict than that: I don't approve *any* puzzle that requires clicking-to-outside to solve.

Outside links are for optional, informational resources. *Not* for problem-critical knowledge.

My comment was more intended towards the author, but if you take the time to correct it yourself, it does cancel my remaining reservations. 

Editing out that spurious carriage return in the first paragraph and approving.
